member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.Unity.InterceptionExtension.Configuration.CallHandlerElement
member.summary: Configuration element representing a call handler.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.Unity.InterceptionExtension.Configuration.PolicyChildElement
member.summary: Base class for the two children of the Policy element: MatchingRuleElement and CallHandlerElement.

remarks.para: These configuration elements have a required "name" attribute, an optional "type" attribute, and optional child elements <lifetime> and <injection>

Elements without a value for the type attribute can only have a value for the name attribute, and indicate that the represented handler or rule is configured elsewhere and that a reference to the given name must be added to the policy to be resolved, while elements with a value for the type attribute indicate how the represented handler or rule should be built and can optionally specify lifetime management and injection configuration.
This element is similar to the , except that it does not provide an extension point for arbitrary configuration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Unity.InterceptionExtension.Configuration.PolicyChildElement.DeserializeElement(System.Xml.XmlReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads XML from the configuration file.
member.param: The that reads from the configuration file.
true to serialize only the collection key properties; otherwise, false.
member.exception: The element to read is locked. - or - An attribute of the current node is not recognized. - or - The lock status of the current node cannot be determined.
